text.p: The following are top stories from selected Singapore newspapers. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Indonesia President Suharto says Indonesia's religious diversity not a barrier to national unity.
- Japan's Liberal Democratic Party works on forming new coalition government but finding other parties having mixed feelings about roles in next ruling coalition.
- Singapore and Australia sign three agreements giving further boost to defence links between two countries.
- New listings Delifrance Asia and Labroy Marine hog spotlight in stock market.
- Singapore Technologies Industrial Corp and NTUC Club Investments' joint venture for family entertainment centres will have 15 outlets by end of year.
- Singapore non-oil domestic exports for the third quarter shrinks 2.4 percent year-on-year in nominal terms.
- Eu Yan Sang plans comeback to the Singapore stock market within three years under bigger group embracing its namesake in Hongkong which would be delisted from Hongkong's exchange.
- Two Indonesian tycoons, Mohammad 'Bob' Hasan and Putera Sampoerna, in head-on fight for biggest block of shares in PT Astra International.
- Indonesian conglomerate Sinar Mas secures licence to build huge palm oil refinery in Ningbo.
- Malaysian tycoon Yahaya Ahmad's Hicom group secures Tekka Corner for Singapore $84 million.
- Tony Tan, managing director of Parkway Holdings Ltd, says it may sell non-healthcare assets within a year.
